Package org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render

Interface Summary
Background Classes that wish to render Plot backgrounds must implement this
FocusPainter Implemented by classes which wish to paint focus indicators for points
LinearGradient Implement this interface to create LinearGradient fill styles for the Canvas
Panel Basic representation of a UI panel that has a size and screen position.
SelfResizing Any UI component that is capable of resizing itself to either an ideal or minimal size.
ZoomListener Listens for requests to zoom into or out of the chart.
 

Class Summary
AbstractPanel Skeletal implementation of Panel, which also provides some helper methods that subclasses will typically need.
AxisPanel Base class for all axis panels, which are panels that surround the center plot panel.
BarChartXYRenderer<T extends Tuple2D>  
CircleFocusPainter Draws a circle around a point with focus
CompositeAxisPanel A container that manages 0 or more AxisPanel objects.
DatasetLegendPanel UI panel containing the dataset legend (a colored line followed by the dataset's name).
DatasetRenderer<T extends Tuple2D> Responsible for visually rendering a Dataset onto a Layer.
DatasetRendererMap Maps a Dataset to the DatasetRenderer that will be responsible for rendering that dataset.
DateRangePanel Draws a date range (e.g.
DomainAxisPanel Renders zoomable dates on x-axis (domain axis).
DrawableDataset<T extends Tuple2D> Represents a dataset along with all the associated information needed to render it.
GssBackground Responsible for rendering the background of a plot
GssElementImpl Convenient class for creating named GssElements
Label  
LegendAxisPanel Renders the dataset legend axis.
LineXYRenderer<T extends Tuple2D> Renders scatter plot, lines, points+lines, or filled areas depending on GSS styling used.
OverviewAxisPanel Renders the overview axis.
RangeAxisPanel Renders a vertical range axis.
RenderState Used by a DatasetRenderer to determine how to render a given dataset curve and its constituent data points.
StringSizer Provides string pixel dimensions to a client.
XYPlotRenderer<T extends Tuple2D> Responsible for iterating over Datasets in a defined drawing order, and then deciding on how to map the visible portions of the domain onto the associated DatasetRenderers.
ZoomInterval Represents one of the zoom intervals (1d, 1m, 1y, 10y, etc.) that appear in the legend axis.
ZoomIntervals A filterable always-sorted set of ZoomInterval objects, which provides the model for the zoom links in the legend axis.
ZoomPanel UI panel containing the clickable zoom levels (e.g.
 

Enum Summary
CompositeAxisPanel.Position Enumerator of the possible positions that this panel can occupy relative to its containing panel.
RangeAxisPanel.TickPosition
